instructions: Heat olive oil and sauté onions and garlic.
Add ground beef, cook until browned.
Stir in tomatoes, tomato paste, and broth.
Season with herbs, salt, and pepper.
Simmer, then serve over cooked spaghetti with Parmesan.

ingredients: Soy sauce and wasabi for serving
instructions: Cook sushi rice and season with vinegar, sugar, and salt.
Place a nori sheet on a bamboo rolling mat.
Spread rice on the nori, add fillings, and roll tightly.
Slice into bite-sized pieces and serve with soy sauce and wasabi.

ingredients: Egg wash (1 egg beaten with 1 tablespoon water)
instructions: Mix yeast, warm milk, and sugar. Let it sit until frothy.
Combine flour and salt, then add the yeast mixture.
Roll out dough, fold with butter, and refrigerate.
Roll, cut, shape, and let rise. Bake until golden brown.

ingredients: 1 lb ground beef or shredded chicken
Salsa and sour cream for topping
instructions: Cook meat with taco seasoning until browned.
Warm taco shells in the oven.
Assemble tacos with meat, veggies, cheese, salsa, and sour cream.

ingredients: Pad Thai sauce (tamarind paste, fish sauce, sugar)
instructions: Soak rice noodles in hot water until softened.
Stir-fry protein in oil, push to the side, and scramble eggs.
Add noodles, sauce, bean sprouts, and green onions. Toss to combine.
Serve hot, garnished with peanuts and lime wedges.
In a pan, heat oil and sauté onions until golden brown.
Add garlic and ginger, cook until fragrant.
Add chicken pieces and brown on all sides.
Stir in tomato puree, yogurt, and spices. Simmer until chicken is cooked.
Garnish with fresh cilantro and serve with rice or naan.
Clean and marinate fish fillets with turmeric and salt.
Mix mustard paste, poppy seed paste, yogurt, green chilies, and salt.
Coat fish with the mustard mixture.
Wrap the marinated fish in banana leaves and tie securely.
Steam or bake the wrapped fish until cooked through.
Heat mustard oil and pour it over the fish before serving.

ingredients: Salt and paprika for fries seasoning
instructions: Divide ground beef into four patties, season with salt and pepper.
Cook the patties on a grill or stovetop until desired doneness.
Toast hamburger buns and assemble burgers with lettuce, tomato, onion, and cheese.
Bake potato fries with olive oil, salt, and paprika until golden brown.
Serve hamburgers with fries, ketchup, and mustard.
Spread butter on dark rye bread slices.
Top with pickled herring fillets and sliced hard-boiled eggs.
Add a dollop of remoulade sauce on top.
Layer with roast beef slices, cucumber, and red onion.
Garnish with fresh dill.
Serve the Smørrebrød open-faced and enjoy!

ingredients: 4 large egg whites, at room temperature
Fresh fruits (berries, kiwi, passionfruit) for topping
instructions: Preheat the oven to 300°F (150°C) and line a baking tray with parchment paper.
In a clean, dry bowl, beat egg whites until stiff peaks form.
Gradually add caster sugar, one tablespoon at a time, while continuing to beat.
Fold in vinegar, vanilla extract, and cornstarch gently.
Pile the meringue onto the prepared tray, forming a nest shape.
Bake in the preheated oven for about 1 hour or until the pavlova is crisp on the outside.
Let it cool completely before topping with whipped cream and fresh fruits.
Serve and enjoy this classic Australian dessert!
Bake or fry the frozen french fries until golden and crispy.
In a saucepan, melt butter over medium heat. Add flour and cook, stirring constantly, until it forms a paste.
Gradually whisk in the broth, continuing to stir to avoid lumps.
Simmer the gravy until it thickens. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Place a generous amount of fries on a serving plate, sprinkle with cheese curds, and pour hot gravy over the top.
Serve immediately, allowing the cheese to melt into the fries.
Enjoy this delicious Canadian comfort food - Poutine!

ingredients: 2-3 pounds beef roast (usually rump or chuck)
instructions: In a large bowl, mix red wine vinegar, water, onion, carrots, garlic, peppercorns, cloves, bay leaves, salt, and pepper.
Place the beef roast in the marinade, cover, and refrigerate for 2-3 days, turning occasionally.
Remove the beef from the marinade and pat dry. Strain and reserve the marinade.
In a Dutch oven, heat vegetable oil and brown the beef on all sides. Remove and set aside.
Stir in flour to make a roux. Gradually add the reserved marinade, stirring constantly to avoid lumps.
Add red currant jelly and bring the mixture to a simmer. Return the beef to the pot.
Cover and simmer on low heat for 2-3 hours until the meat is tender.
If desired, crumble gingersnap cookies into the gravy to thicken it.
Slice the Sauerbraten and serve with the rich gravy.
Enjoy this classic German dish with sides like red cabbage and potato dumplings!
In a bowl, mix rye flour, all-purpose flour, and salt. Gradually add water, kneading until a smooth dough forms. Let it rest for 30 minutes.
Divide the dough into small balls and roll each ball into a thin, flat round shape.
For the rice filling, mix cooked rice with butter and salt. For the potato filling, mix mashed potatoes with butter and salt.
Place a spoonful of either rice or potato filling on each dough round, fold, and crimp the edges to seal.
Bake in a preheated oven at 475°F (245°C) for about 15 minutes or until golden brown.
For the egg butter, mix chopped hard-boiled eggs with softened butter and salt.
Serve the Karelian pasties warm with a dollop of egg butter.
Enjoy this traditional Finnish pastry, Karjalanpiirakka!
